data.title: Sadly, This Business is Closed
data.text: This business is no longer open. Too bad though, as the food was good and there was really nice customer service. I think they are still doing mobile sales here and there though, so try to catch them out and about the community.

data.title: You better be hungry!
data.text: This is a local family-owned business. Servers were friendly and on top of things. Their fries are some of the best I've ever had, peel on, crispy/crunchy on the outside and tender on the inside! The brisket sandwich I had was delicious. There was enough meat on it for 2 sandwiches! The sauce was sweet, but not too sweet. It's kind of a grungy looking place, probably due to the fact it use to be a bar, but it was clean. We were there on an extremely hot day and it was warm inside, but not unbearable by any means.

data.title: Best BBQ in Topeka
data.text: This place is fantastic. Heart attack fries are incredible. You have to try this place. The bbq sauce is really smoky and savory, I wish you could buy bottles of it. The mac and cheese is also above average - nice and thick and cheesy.

data.title: Good but nothing to brag about
data.text: We were looking for good BBQ that wasn't part of a chain. This worked. Sauce was good and thick (which apparently is hard to find in Kansas). Fries seemed homemade and were tasty. Baked beans were better tasting than expected by looking at them but I'm pretty sure they were just canned beans with BBQ sauce added. They had a band playing (Friday night) that was pretty decent but so loud we couldn't talk to each other at the table. Overall nothing was bad and is worth a try, but we will continue looking for something better.

data.title: First timer
data.text: The BBQ Burger Meal was my first choice at the eatery.  The BBQ sauce is very good. The patty was alittle thick.  Big on flavor. Fries cooked just right. I will be back for more.
